gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components
Class ObjectState

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.ObjectState
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ObjectState
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

This class is used to preserve the state of on object. Similar to Java's Hashtable, ObjectState uses a key to identify a field. However, since ObjectStates can be nested, recursion is used to find which table the field is contained in. Recursion is only available if the key is a string and incorporates the following naming convention:

ClassName1.ClassName2.ClassNameN.Key

Each class that uses ObjectState should specify a public static final key_name for each field whose state is being preserved.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

GLOBAL

public static final java.lang.String GLOBAL
GLOBAL string constant is a prefix used by any state variable that needs to be reset at every level of recursion. Note that if this prefix is used, any value with the same key as GLOBAL.key will be altered. The use of GLOBAL is restricted to reset() only. insert() will do nothing but return false if GLOBAL is used for inserting.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

ObjectState

public ObjectState()
Constructor - Initializes the Hashtable

Method Detail

insert

public boolean insert(java.lang.Object key,
                      java.lang.Object field)
This method adds a field and its key to the hashtable. If the key already exists, the new field will not replace the old field. To alter a field that has a key already in the hashtable, use the method reset(). This method will return true if the put was successful. Since this method takes in an Object for a field value, primative types must be stored in their Object equivalent. Ex: int -> Integer, boolean -> Boolean, ect.

Parameters:
key -
field -
Returns:
true if field and key were added, false if key already existed in the hashtable.

get

public java.lang.Object get(java.lang.Object key)
This method retrieves a field referenced by the key. If key does not exist, null is returned. Since the put() method takes in an Object for a field value, primative types must be stored in their Object equivalent. Ex: int -> Integer, boolean -> Boolean, ect. Because of this, the returned Object will never be a primative type. If GLOBAL.key is used, all instances of the key will be returned in the following form: If key not found, null is returned. If any instance of the key is found, a Vector containing all of the values is returned. To decifer values, the entries in the Vector will be a two-element Object[] consisting of the full path key and the value.

Example use of GLOBAL
ObjectState1 contains key1(Float), key2(Float), key3(ObjectState2)
ObjectState2 contains key1(String), key4(Integer), key5(ObjectState3)
ObjectState3 contains key6(Float), key1(Float)

Calling get(GLOBAL.key1) would return:
Vector containing three Object[2] pairs.
Element 1: Object[0] = String key3.key5.key1, Object[1] = Float value
Element 2: Object[0] = String key3.key1, Object[1] = String value
Element 3: Object[0] = String key1, Object[1] = Float value

Parameters:
key - Key referencing the saved value. Key does not have to be a String unless the value is in an imbedded ObjectState, but use of Strings is recommended.
Returns:
The value referenced by the key. If GLOBAL.key is used, the returned value will be a Vector of two-element Object arrays. See method description for more detail. If key is not found, null is returned.

getValues

public java.util.Enumeration getValues()
Used to get an enumeration of all of the values contained in this ObjectState.

Returns:
A list of all of the values stored in this ObjectState.

getKeys

public java.util.Enumeration getKeys()
Used to get an enumeration of the keys used to access the values in this ObjectState.

Returns:
A list of the keys used to access the data in this ObjectState.

reset

public boolean reset(java.lang.Object key,
                     java.lang.Object field)
This method is used to alter the value of a field that is already in the ObjectState hashtable. If the field has not yet been added, use the insert() method to add the field to the ObjectState hashtable. This method will return true if the reset was successful.

Parameters:
key -
field -
Returns:
  • true - if reset successful
  • false - if key was not found or if field was null

size

public int size()
Get the number of keys stored in this ObjectState.

Returns:
size - integer number of keys

containsKey

public boolean containsKey(java.lang.String key)
Used to determine if the given key is used in this ObjectState.

Parameters:
key - The key to analyze.
Returns:
True if the given key is used used in this ObjectState and false if it isn't.

silentFileChooser

public boolean silentFileChooser(java.lang.String filename,
                                 boolean isSave)
This method is an alternative way to read/write files, without the GUI. Using this method allows the programmer to read/write a file without the user knowing. This is handy when loading default state information.

Parameters:
filename - The filename where to read/write file, Includes full path.
isSave - true if saving state, false if loading state
Returns:
true if save/load was successful, false if unsuccessful

openFileChooser

public boolean openFileChooser(boolean isSave)
This method will pop-up a JFileChooser to allow ObjectState to be loaded or saved.

Parameters:
isSave - true if saving state, false if loading state
Returns:
true if save/load was successful, false if unsuccessful or operation was cancelled.

setProjectsDirectory

public void setProjectsDirectory(java.lang.String dir)
Sets the directory for the state save files to go into. By default, files are saved to the home directory.

Parameters:
dir - Directory projects are to be saved to.

getProjectsDirectory

public java.lang.String getProjectsDirectory()
Gets the directory for the state save files. By default, projects are saved to the home directory.

Returns:
Directory where files will be saved to.

toString in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
String representation of this ObjectState.
